problem.title: CheckPoint: Torque and Angular Impulse
problem.script:
from __future__ import division from loncapa import *
#Enter the computations here a=lc_random(1,3,1) b=lc_random(1,3,1) c=lc_random(1,3,1) d=lc_random(1,3,1) m=lc_choose(a,2.0,5.0,8.0) r=lc_choose(b,0.25,0.45,0.60) o=lc_choose(c,0.60,2.20,4.80) w=lc_choose(d,1.60,2.80,3.40)
A= 0.4*( m* r* r)*( o + w) B= 0.1*( m* r* r)*( o + w)
problem.p: A solid sphere of mass m = $m kg and radius r = $r m is spinning about the axis passing through the center of the sphere. At t = 0, the angular speed of the sphere is \(\omega_{0}\) = $o rad/s and the sphere rotates clockwise. At t = 4.0 s, the angular speed is \(\omega \) = $w rad/s and the sphere rotates counterclockwise.

part.p: Part A. What is the magnitude of the angular impulse applied to the sphere between t = 0 and t = 4.0 s? Enter the answer in [N.m.s-1].

problem.part:
Part B. Assuming that the torque applied to the sphere is constant between t = 0 and t = 4.0 s, what is the magnitude of that torque?
\(\tau_{axis} \) [N.m] =
